Content: <@270272935502151682> fortnite uses bloom_ which means ur bullets will go at a random place inside ur crosshair_ so if its wide say when ur jumping or running_ u have a larger "potential" area for ur shots
<@411638162952028161> if u look closely u will see that building is a part of fighting_ and its constantly evolving
<@279654208012156929> yeah_ change permissions on ur gameusersettings.ini from read only to read and write
okay_ that could be a cause for it then
the size of the hard drive doesnt matter_ its about the speed
i cant guarantee this is whats causing ur problem_ but it sure is possible
well even if fortnite was running as it should_ u really want an ssd today

if ur running some specific settings that u wanna stick with u can just have it on read and write_ set everything up in game_ close the game and change it to read only_ then u will always load in with the same settings

<@279654208012156929> what shouldnt matter? one upside of having it read only is if u accidentally make ur game windowed or so_ then u just need to restart it_ rather than to change all the resolutions etc again
